intro: Cyrtandra alikaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments, often growing on rocky slopes or in streamside habitats. It plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
